Package me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.decomposition

Class StorageDecomposer<T>

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.storageapi.decomposition.StorageDecomposer<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of class this Decomposer refers to.
public class StorageDecomposer<T> extends Object
This class provides an extremely easy way to store large objects by splitting them into components to store into the data structure. These components are then saved individually, and then can be retrieved to re-compose the Object. For example, we may want to store a Location value with x, y and z components. We can add a StorageDecomposer, to split the Location into a X, Y, and Z. The StorageDecomposer would then save these components for us automatically whenever a Location is provided into StorageContainer.store(String, Object). To retrieve the Location back, we can use StorageContainer.retrieve(Class, String) with the Location.class parameter.

  • Constructor Details

    • StorageDecomposer

      public StorageDecomposer(Class<T> type, Function<T,DecomposedObject> decomposeFunction)
      Parameters:
      type - The type of class this Decomposer refers to.
      decomposeFunction - A Function that determines how this type of Object is decomposed. This should return a DecomposedObject with the provided paths and objects.
      See Also:
      • DecomposedObject
      • DecomposedObject.addDecomposedKey(String, Object)

    • StorageDecomposer

      public StorageDecomposer(Class<T> type, Function<T,DecomposedObject> decomposeFunction, BiFunction<StorageContainer,RecomposedObject<T>,CompletableFuture<T>> recomposeFunction)
      Parameters:
      type - The type of class this Decomposer refers to.
      decomposeFunction - A Function that determines how this type of Object is decomposed. This Function accepts the Object that a user was going to store, and will always be of type T. This should return a DecomposedObject with the provided paths and objects.
      recomposeFunction - A BiFunction How the StorageDecomposer should retrieve and recompose the Object. This accepts the StorageContainer and the RecomposedObject, and should return a CompletableFuture for returning the final Object.
      See Also:
      • DecomposedObject
      • DecomposedObject.addDecomposedKey(String, Object)
      • RecomposedObject.addRecomposeKey(String, Class, Function)
      • RecomposedObject.addCompletedRecomposeKey(String, Function)

  • Method Details

    • applyDecompose

      public DecomposedObject applyDecompose(Object object) throws ClassCastException
      Applies the decomposed function to an Object.
      Parameters:
      object - The Object to decompose using this StorageDecomposer.
      Returns:
      The DecomposedObject that is returned by the Function.
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if the provided Object is not of type T.

    • applyRecompose

      public CompletableFuture<T> applyRecompose(StorageContainer container, String path)
      Applies the recompose function to a Container and Path. Within the path, a %path% string should exist. This will be replaced with each of the recomposed keys. For example, if we have homes.cool_home.%path%, the recompose function should retrieve homes.cool_home.x homes.cool_home.y homes.cool_home.z homes.cool_home.world
      Parameters:
      container - The container to retrieve data from.
      path - The path to retrieve data from for the recomposition.
      Returns:
      A CompletableFuture that will complete when the recompose is finished, or null if the function does not exist.

    • getType

      public Class<T> getType()
      Returns:
      The type of the StorageDecomposer

      public Function<T,DecomposedObject> getDecomposeFunction()
      Returns:
      The decomposition Function that will be used for decomposing.

    • getRecomposeFunction

      public BiFunction<StorageContainer,RecomposedObject<T>,CompletableFuture<T>> getRecomposeFunction()
      Returns:
      The recomposition BiFunction that will be used for recomposing.
